en: After your shift, you're led to a secret resistance meeting in an abandoned starch factory.
Before we begin... I have a confession to make.
That note you found on your first day? "[color=GOLD]A friend[/color]"?
Sasha smiles. I see you kept it. Smart. I knew I picked the right sprout.
I've been watching new officers for months, looking for someone with [color=CHARTREUSE]questioning eyes[/color]. Someone who might see through the lies.
Sasha's expression is complicated. You showed it to Russet. I had to lay low for weeks after that.
But here you are anyway. That tells me something about your conscience.
You destroyed it. I don't blame you - it was risky to keep.
But the words found their way into your head anyway, didn't they?
[color=CHARTREUSE]I am "A friend."[/color] And now you know why.
Sasha spreads captured documents on the table. Processing manifests from the past month.
You scan the names, and your blood runs cold.
There it is. [color=GOLD]Maris Piper[/color]. The woman from the photo.
"[color=CRIMSON]Status: Processed. Batch RR-2847.[/color]" Dated three days after her husband begged for your help.
You feel the photo in your pocket. [color=STEEL_BLUE]She's gone. And you couldn't save her.[/color]
But maybe... [color=CHARTREUSE]maybe you can still save others[/color].
Murphy emerges from the shadows. Hey. Glad you made it.
Murphy holds up the crumpled RR-UTIL form. My cousin's on that list too. [color=CHARTREUSE]We're doing this together.[/color]
A weathered potato with battle scars addresses the assembled group.
The time for whispers and pamphlets is over. The government has shown its true colors.
Our sources confirm that [wave amp=15 freq=2][color=DARK_VIOLET]Root Reserve[/color][/wave] processing plants are increasing production.
Which means [tornado radius=3 freq=3][color=CRIMSON]more of our brothers and sisters disappeared, processed, consumed[/color][/tornado].
The leader pounds a fist on the table. [pulse freq=3][color=CHARTREUSE]This ends now.[/color][/pulse] We have a plan to strike at the heart of their operation.
Sasha unfurls detailed plans on the table. In three days, we launch our primary offensive.
While one team creates a diversion at the main government complex, another will infiltrate the largest Root Reserve facility.
Our goal: obtain [color=CHARTREUSE]irrefutable evidence[/color] of what happens inside, broadcast it to all of Spud.
Sasha points to a section of the plans. This is where you come in.
We need someone on the inside at Spud Customs to ensure our operatives can cross the border for the mission.
Can we count on you to be that person?
"I'll do whatever it takes to expose the truth."
"It sounds dangerous. What if we get caught?"
"Is there another way that doesn't put so many at risk?"
Sasha's face lights up with hope. Thank you. [color=CHARTREUSE]Your courage will save countless lives.[/color]
She squeezes your hand. When this is all over, [color=CHARTREUSE]you'll be remembered as a hero of the revolution.[/color]
[color=STEEL_BLUE]Sasha's hopeful expression falters.[/color] I... yes. It is dangerous.
We could all end up [color=DARK_VIOLET]processed into Root Reserve[/color] ourselves if we fail.
[color=STEEL_BLUE]She looks away briefly.[/color] I thought after everything you'd seen... but I understand. Fear is natural.
[color=STEEL_BLUE]Sasha's face falls. The light in her eyes dims.[/color] Another way? We've tried other ways. For years.
Petitions. Quiet diplomacy. Anonymous tips. [color=STEEL_BLUE]Her voice turns cold.[/color] Nothing has worked.
I was hoping you'd be different. That you understood what's at stake.
A heated debate breaks out among the resistance members.
Some argue for a more aggressive approach – destroying the processing plants entirely.
Others insist that violent action will only turn public opinion against them.
ENOUGH! The leader silences the room with a commanding voice.
We cannot afford to be divided. Not now, when we're so close.
Our goal is simple: reveal the truth. Let the people decide what happens next.
The leader turns to address you directly. But we need to know [color=YELLOW]where you stand[/color].
In three days, our agents will approach your checkpoint. They'll carry [color=CHARTREUSE]blue identification cards[/color].
Will you help them cross? Your answer now will determine our next move.
"I'll help them cross. For the future of Spud."
"I can't be directly involved, but I'll look the other way."
"I need more time to think about this."
The leader clasps your shoulder firmly. [color=CHARTREUSE]Your courage honors us all.[/color]
On the third day, when the sun is highest, our agents will come.
The password is "[wave amp=15 freq=3][color=CHARTREUSE]The roots grow deep.[/color][/wave]" Remember it.
The leader nods slowly, clearly disappointed but understanding.
Sometimes the most we can ask is for people not to stand in our way.
Our agents will proceed as planned. Just... don't raise the alarm.
The leader's expression hardens. [color=YELLOW]Time is a luxury we don't have.[/color]
But forcing anyone to join our cause makes us no better than them.
We'll proceed without counting on your help. Search your conscience.
As the meeting breaks up, Sasha walks with you back toward the checkpoint.
[color=CHARTREUSE]She takes your hand as you walk.[/color] Whatever happens... we're in this together now. Thank you.
[color=STEEL_BLUE]She keeps her distance as you walk.[/color] I appreciate you not standing in our way. It's... something.
[color=STEEL_BLUE]She walks in silence, arms crossed.[/color] I hope you find whatever certainty you're looking for. The rest of us can't afford to wait.
On your way back, you find Viktor alone on the checkpoint roof, staring at the night sky.
Viktor holds a small
column3: worn photograph. His voice is barely a whisper. [color=STEEL_BLUE]Elena loved the stars.[/color]

en: She used to say that no matter how dark things got, the stars would still be there. [color=STEEL_BLUE]Constant. Beautiful.[/color]
He turns to you, eyes glistening. [wave amp=15 freq=2]I keep thinking... did she suffer?[/wave] Did she know what was happening?
Viktor's voice cracks. She asked me once if I ever questioned the rejections. I told her [color=CRIMSON]to trust the system[/color].
[tornado radius=3 freq=2][color=CRIMSON]I sent my own wife to the processing vats without knowing it.[/color][/tornado]
"You couldn't have known. None of us knew."
"Elena would want you to fight now, not drown in guilt."
"I don't know what to say. I'm sorry."
He shakes his head slowly. [color=STEEL_BLUE]Ignorance isn't innocence. I should have asked. Should have listened.[/color]
Viktor carefully tucks the photo away. [color=CHARTREUSE]But now I know. And knowing means I have to act.[/color]
Viktor straightens, a cold fire rekindling in his eyes. [color=CHARTREUSE]You're right.[/color] She was stronger than me. Braver.
He clenches his fist. [color=CHARTREUSE]When the time comes
column3: I'll make sure her death meant something.[/color]

en: [pulse freq=2][color=CRIMSON]And Idaho will pay for every life he's consumed.[/color][/pulse]
Viktor manages a sad
column3: bitter smile. [color=STEEL_BLUE]Honesty. That's rare here. Thank you.[/color]

en: He looks back at the stars. [color=STEEL_BLUE]Elena would have liked you.[/color]
He turns to leave, then pauses. [color=CHARTREUSE]When the resistance moves... I'll be ready.[/color]
For Elena. For all of them. [pulse freq=2][color=CHARTREUSE]The guards will follow me when I tell them the truth.[/color][/pulse]
You return to your quarters at the checkpoint, mind racing with the weight of coming events.
In just three days, everything could change. [color=YELLOW]For better or worse.[/color]
